intro: Adesmia grisea, commonly known as the gray adesmia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, arid environments and is adapted to withstand harsh conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable for extended periods, contributing to its survival in challenging habitats. Adesmia grisea is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
